abstract: Embattled film executive David Bergstein has countersued hedge fund D.B. Zwirn, blaming the bankrupt firm for the lion’s share of his and business partner Ronald Tutor’s woes, The Hollywood Reporter said.
snippet: Embattled film executive David Bergstein has countersued hedge fund D.B. Zwirn, blaming the bankrupt firm for the lion’s share of his and business partner Ronald Tutor’s woes, The Hollywood Reporter said.
lead_paragraph: Embattled film executive David Bergstein has countersued hedge fund D.B. Zwirn, blaming the bankrupt firm for the lion’s share of his and business partner Ronald Tutor’s woes, The Hollywood Reporter said in an article posted to its Web site on Thursday.

headline.main: Embattled Movie Executive Sues Zwirn and Fortress

abstract: People are wagering on the S.E.C. case against Goldman Sachs and the fate of Lloyd C. Blankfein in an online futures market.
snippet: People are wagering on the S.E.C. case against Goldman Sachs and the fate of Lloyd C. Blankfein in an online futures market.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs, if you listen to Congress, is little more than a casino where gamblers masquerade as traders and bet on the fortunes of the rest of us. Well, now the rest of us can bet on Goldman,  Nelson D. Schwartz of The New York Times reports.

headline.main: Think Blankfein Will Resign? Want to Bet?

abstract: A conversation with Mark D. Rasch, the former head of the United States Department of Justice computer crime unit, discussing the legal technicalities of the case of the missing iPhone 4G.
snippet: A conversation with Mark D. Rasch, the former head of the United States Department of Justice computer crime unit, discussing the legal technicalities of the case of the missing iPhone 4G.
lead_paragraph: The iPhone-lost-in-a-bar story raises all sorts of legal questions. To explore them further, I spoke with Mark D. Rasch who is the former head of the United States Department of Justice computer crime unit, and helped develop the department’s guidelines for computer crimes related to investigations, forensics and evidence gathering. Mr. Rasch is currently a principal with Secure IT Experts, a consulting company that specializes in computer security. The Q.&A. below is an edited version of our discussion.

headline.main: iPhonegate: Q.&A. With Mark D. Rasch, Computer Security Expert
